title-group.article-title: An Analysis of a Superconvergence Result for a Singularly Perturbed Boundary Value Problem

abstract.p: We give a new proof that the El-Mistikawy and Werle finite-difference scheme is uniformly second-order accurate for a nonselfadjoint singularly perturbed boundary value problem. To do this, we use exponential finite elements and a discretized Green's function. The proof is direct, gives the nodal errors explicitly in integral form, and involves much less computation than in previous proofs of the result.
